verses.text: When a man hath taken a wife , and married her, and it come to pass that she find no favour in his eyes , because he hath found some uncleanness in her: then let him write her a bill of divorcement , and give \add it\add* in her hand , and send her out of his house.\f + \fr 24.1 \ft some…: Heb. matter of nakedness\f*\f + \fr 24.1 \ft divorcement: Heb. cutting off\f*
And when she is departed out of his house , she may go and be another man’s \add wife\add*.

And \add if\add* the latter husband hate her, and write her a bill of divorcement , and giveth \add it\add* in her hand , and sendeth her out of his house ; or if the latter husband die , which took her \add to be\add* his wife ;

Her former husband , which sent her away , may not take her again to be his wife , after that she is defiled ; for that \add is\add* abomination before the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*: and thou shalt not cause the land to sin , which the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* thy God giveth thee \add for\add* an inheritance. \p

¶ When a man hath taken a new wife , he shall not go out to war , neither shall he be charged with any business : \add but\add* he shall be free at home one year , and shall cheer up his wife which he hath taken.\f + \fr 24.5 \ft neither…: Heb. not any thing shall pass upon him\f* \p
¶ No man shall take the nether or the upper millstone to pledge : for he taketh \add a man’s\add* life to pledge. \p
¶ If a man be found stealing any of his brethren of the children of Israel , and maketh merchandise of him, or selleth him; then that thief shall die ; and thou shalt put evil away from among you. \p
¶ Take heed in the plague of leprosy , that thou observe diligently , and do according to all that the priests the Levites shall teach you: as I commanded them, \add so\add* ye shall observe to do.
Remember what the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* thy God did unto Miriam by the way , after that ye were come forth out of Egypt. \p
¶ When thou dost lend thy brother any thing , thou shalt not go into his house to fetch his pledge.\f + \fr 24.10 \ft lend…: Heb. lend the loan of any thing to, etc\f*
Thou shalt stand abroad , and the man to whom thou dost lend shall bring out the pledge abroad unto thee.
And if the man \add be\add* poor , thou shalt not sleep with his pledge :

In any case thou shalt deliver him the pledge again when the sun goeth down , that he may sleep in his own raiment , and bless thee: and it shall be righteousness unto thee before the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* thy God. \p
¶ Thou shalt not oppress an hired servant \add that is\add* poor and needy , \add whether he be\add* of thy brethren , or of thy strangers that \add are\add* in thy land within thy gates :

At his day thou shalt give \add him\add* his hire , neither shall the sun go down upon it; for he \add is\add* poor , and setteth his heart upon it: lest he cry against thee unto the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, and it be sin unto thee.\f + \fr 24.15 \ft setteth…: Heb. lifteth his soul unto it\f*
The fathers shall not be put to death for the children , neither shall the children be put to death for the fathers : every man shall be put to death for his own sin. \p
¶ Thou shalt not pervert the judgment of the stranger , \add nor\add* of the fatherless ; nor take a widow’s raiment to pledge :
But thou shalt remember that thou wast a bondman in Egypt , and the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* thy God redeemed thee thence: therefore I command thee to do this thing. \p

¶ When thou cuttest down thine harvest in thy field , and hast forgot a sheaf in the field , thou shalt not go again to fetch it: it shall be for the stranger , for the fatherless , and for the widow : that the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* thy God may bless thee in all the work of thine hands.

When thou beatest thine olive tree , thou shalt not go over the boughs again : it shall be for the stranger , for the fatherless , and for the widow.\f + \fr 24.20 \ft go…: Heb. bough it after thee\f*

When thou gatherest the grapes of thy vineyard , thou shalt not glean \add it\add* afterward : it shall be for the stranger , for the fatherless , and for the widow.\f + \fr 24.21 \ft afterward: Heb. after thee\f*
And thou shalt remember that thou wast a bondman in the land of Egypt : therefore I command thee to do this thing.
